item.title: Renaming files in a git repository
item.description: If you are using git for your data science project (which you should!), you have to be careful when renaming a file. If you simply rename the file in your OS file browser, git would interpret this as deleting the file with the old name and creating a new one with the new name. They wouldn’t be linked in any way and you’d essentially loose the history of that file.
